intro: Crepidorhopalon latibracteatus, commonly known as the broad-bract crepidorhopalon, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its unique, elongated leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are typically small and yellowish-green, with prominent bracts that serve as modified leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
